Gloss: old DECL man
Translation: The man is old.

Gloss: DEM motorcycle P5 DECL bad
Translation: This motorcycle is bad.
Comment: The morpheme tsi, glossed as “position 5 formative” (p5) optionally occurs when there is a fronted stem or constituent in position 2 or 3 (Tallman, 2018: p. 304).

Gloss: man old
Translation: an/the old man

Gloss: motorcycle bad
Translation: a/the bad motorcycle

Gloss: motorcycle bad highway go=NMLZ:PURP buy=DECL.NPST Paë
Translation: Paë buys/will buy a motorcycle (which is) bad for driving on the highway.

Gloss: woman pretty Adam=DAT run=DECL.PST 3SG.GEN house=DAT
Translation: A woman pretty to Adam (which Adam finds pretty) ran to his house.
Comment: ki (non-past) forces the subject to appear after the clause-type morpheme (and thus postverbally).

Gloss: motorcycle highway go=NMLZ:PURP bad buy=DECL.NPST Paë
Translation: Paë buys/will buy a motorcycle (which is) bad for driving on the highway.
Comment: Speakers insisted on relativizing the constructions with ka(to).

Gloss: motorcycle highway go=NMLZ:PURP bad=REL buy=DECL.NPST Paë
Translation: Paë buys/will buy a motorcycle (which is) bad for driving on the highway.
Comment: Speakers insisted on relativizing the constructions with ka(to).

Morphemic: naa motó tsi ȿo [yói karetera ka=tí].
Gloss: DEM motorcycle P5 DECL bad highway go=NMLZ:PURP
Translation: The motorcycle is bad for driving on the highway.
Comment: Having the modifier phrases after the adjective appears to be more natural, but both of these were accepted.

Morphemic: naa motó tsi ȿo [karetera ka=tí yói].
Gloss: DEM motorcycle P5 DECL highway go=NMLZ:PURP bad
Translation: The motorcycle is bad for driving on the highway.

Gloss: DEM woman P5 DECL pretty Adam=DAT
Translation: This woman is pretty to Adam (Adam finds her pretty).

Gloss: DEM woman P5 DECL Adam=DAT pretty
Translation: This woman is pretty to Adam (Adam finds her pretty).

Morphemic: awi óʂa=ka tsáya hóni siri=’ wa=kɨ
Gloss: wife sleep=REL see man old=ERG TR=DE:P
Translation: The old man saw his wife who was asleep.

Morphemic: ha ʃi-toʂ-a=kan=(ʔ)á=ka kaʃi yoi tsi kiá pakɨ=ní=kɨ.
Gloss: 3 chest-hit-TR=PL=NMLZ:P=REL bat poor P5 REP fall=REMP=DEC:P
Translation: The poor bat who they hit in the chest fell.

Gloss: woman Adam=DAT pretty=REL run=DECL.PST 3SG.GEN house=DAT
Translation: A woman pretty to Adam (which Adam finds pretty) ran to his house.

Morphemic: honi ȿobo tsaya=ȿɨni raaʔa yoȿa=’ wa=kɨ.
Gloss: man house look_at=ADJLZ scold woman=ERG TR=DECL.PST
Translation: The woman scolded the man who always looks at houses (lit. the always-house-looking man).
Comment: The speaker stated that the sentence sounded better if there was a pause after the first word – suggesting that there was really something hard to process about this sentence.

Morphemic: yoȿa raaʔa honi ȿobo tsaya=ȿɨni=’ wa=kɨ.
Gloss: woman scold man house look_at=ADJLZ=ERG TR=DECL.PST
Translation: The man who always looks at houses (lit. the always-house-looking man) scolded the woman/wife.
Comment: Unclear whether the construction should be regarded as complex APs or appositional N-clausal N combinations.

Morphemic: yoʂa pistia tsayá tsi ha wa=tɨkɨ(n)=ka(n)=ní=kɨ
Gloss: woman small see P5 3 TR=AGAIN=PL=REMP=DEC:P
Translation: They saw the young woman again.

Gloss: outside=A dog Gere=ERG dance=CAUS=DECL.PST
Translation: Gere made the dog dance from outside (i.e. Gere was outside).
Comment: If an adjunct that modifies an N(P) is in first or last position in the clause then it can be marked for a participant agreement marking that tells you which of the core arguments it is associated with.

Gloss: kára míʃni=bo no inia i=pao=ní=kɨ toro=kí
Translation: rubber little=PL 1PL sell AUX=HAB=REMP=DEC:P Toro=DAT
Source: We used to sell a little bit of rubber to Toro.

Gloss: man canoe=SPAT=REL
Translation: the man (who is) in the canoe

Gloss: DEM house=SPAT=REL child
Translation: this child in the house

Gloss: man arrow=COM
Translation: the man with the arrow
Comment: The comitative marker allows the relevant word order.

Gloss: rain=COM season
Translation: the rainy season (lit. the time with rain/sun)
